perturbation.original_text:
Global Price List means a complete listing of those Cisco products, services, including products and services which Cisco may make available to Distributor at its sole discretion, and associated prices.

Value Added Distributor Price List shall mean a portion of the Global Price List containing Products which Cisco makes available to Distributor for stocking and the prices at which Cisco will sell such Products to Distributor.
perturbation.changed_text:
Global Price List means a listing of some Cisco products, services, and associated prices. Cisco decides which ones are listed there.

Value Added Distributor Price List shall mean a completely separate list from the Global Price List, containing Products which Cisco makes available to Distributor for stocking and the prices at which Cisco will sell such Products to Distributor.
perturbation.explanation: The original defines Value Added Distributor Price List as a *portion* of the Global Price List. The modified version defines it as a 'completely separate list', creating conflicting definitions of the relationship between the two price lists. It becomes unclear which products from the Global Price List are sold on the Value Added Distributor Price List or if they are completely different lists.

perturbation.original_text:
10.1 C i s c o  P r o d u c t s  a r e  p r o v i d e d  w i t h  w r i t t e n  l i m i t e d  w a r r a n t i e s ,  a s  s e t  f o r t h  a t  t h e  f o l l o w i n g  U R L : http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/cc/serv/mkt/sup/tsssv/wnty/. Distributor will pass through to Resellers all written limited warranties provided by Cisco with Products purchased by Distributor and Distributor shall contractually require (in whatever manner Distributor deems appropriate) each such Reseller to provide such warranty and other terms to any End User to which the Reseller redistributes the Product.

10.2 In addition to the written limited warranty provided by Cisco with its Products, such warranty statement shall apply to Distributor during the period between when it receives a Product and when it resells or redistributes such Product,

10.3 Notwithstanding any other provision hereof, Cisco's sole and exclusive warranty and obligation with respect to the Products sold hereunder are set forth in Cisco's Limited Warranty Statement delivered with the Product. Distributor SHALL NOT MAKE ANY WARRANTY COMMITMENT, WHETHER WRITTEN OR ORAL, ON CISCO'S BEHALF. Distributor shall indemnify Cisco against any warranties made in addition to Cisco's standard warranty and for any misrepresentation of Cisco's reputation or Cisco's Products.
perturbation.changed_text:
10.1 C i s c o  P r o d u c t s  a r e  p r o v i d e d  w i t h  w r i t t e n  l i m i t e d  w a r r a n t i e s ,  a s  s e t  f o r t h  a t  t h e  f o l l o w i n g  U R L : http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/cc/serv/mkt/sup/tsssv/wnty/. Distributor will pass through to Resellers all written limited warranties provided by Cisco with Products purchased by Distributor and Distributor may at their option, decide to extend the warranties based on their discretion. 

10.2 In addition to the written limited warranty provided by Cisco with its Products, such warranty statement shall apply to Distributor indefinitely.

10.3 Notwithstanding any other provision hereof, Cisco's sole and exclusive warranty and obligation with respect to the Products sold hereunder are set forth in Cisco's Limited Warranty Statement delivered with the Product. Distributor MAY MAKE ANY WARRANTY COMMITMENT, WHETHER WRITTEN OR ORAL, ON CISCO'S BEHALF. Distributor shall indemnify Cisco against any warranties made in addition to Cisco's standard warranty and for any misrepresentation of Cisco's reputation or Cisco's Products.
perturbation.explanation: Section 10.1 originally states distributor *shall* pass the warranties while the modification of 10.1 indicates the distributor *may at their option, decide to extend the warranties*. Further Section 10.2 indicates the warranty to distributor applies 'indefinitely', opposing the idea that the warranty statement is *limited*. Lastly, section 10.3 originally indicates the distributor *shall not make any warranty commitment* while the modification indicates the distributor *may make any warranty commitment*. This creates an internal contradiction by replacing the shall not with shall, making the limitation on warranty commitment ambigious.

perturbation.original_text: 18.1 This Agreement shall commence on the Effective Date and continue thereafter for a period of two (2) years, unless extended by written agreement of both parties or sooner terminated as set forth below. Without prejudice to either party's right to terminate this Agreement as set forth in sub​ sections 18.2 to 18.5 below, Cisco may, by written notice to Distributor, given at least thirty (30) days prior to the end of the then-current term of the Agreement, extend the term of the Agreement for the period set forth in such notice, up to a maximum of one (1) year beyond the then- current expiration date. Any extension shall be on the same terms and conditions then in force, except as may be mutually agreed in writing by the parties. In the event the Agreement expires and Cisco intends to not renew the Agreement, Cisco will provide written notice of same to Distributor. Notwithstanding Cisco's right to extend the term of this Agreement, each party acknowledges that this Agreement shall always be interpreted as being limited in duration to a definite term and that the other party has made no commitments whatsoever regarding the duration or renewal of this Agreement beyond those expressly stated herein.
perturbation.changed_text: 18.1 This Agreement shall commence on the Effective Date and continue thereafter for a period of two (2) years, unless extended by written agreement of both parties or sooner terminated as set forth below. Without prejudice to either party's right to terminate this Agreement as set forth in sub​ sections 18.2 to 18.5 below, Cisco may, without notice, extend the term of the Agreement indefinitely. Any extension shall be on the same terms and conditions then in force, except as may be unilaterally changed in writing by Cisco. In the event the Agreement expires and Cisco intends to not renew the Agreement, Cisco will provide written notice of same to Distributor. Notwithstanding Cisco's right to extend the term of this Agreement, each party acknowledges that this Agreement may be interpreted as being unlimited in duration and that the other party may make commitments whatsoever regarding the duration or renewal of this Agreement beyond those expressly stated herein.
perturbation.explanation: The original section states that the agreement is for a period of two years which is limited in duration and that there may only be an agreement of both parties when extended. The modification indicates that there may be an indefinite extension and may be unilaterally changed in writing by Cisco without notice. Furthermore, instead of acknowledging a 'limited' duration, the modified segment indicates that it may be 'unlimited'.
